utterance: <speak>Within the area of, physical and chemical changes, please select a topic by clicking on a picture below.</speak>
<speak>Below are some variables that might affect the reaction between soda and mints. you can test one of these variables in your experiment</speak>
<speak>The type of sweetener in the soda, The amount of caffeine in the soda, The surface texture of the mint, and the amount of carbon dioxide in the soda</speak>
<speak>Here are all of the materials that may be necessary for this experiment, a mint, a bottle of soda, and a ruler.</speak>
<speak>We will put a single mint into a bottle of soda</speak>
<speak>Bubbles forming a soda guyzer may come out of the bottle</speak>
<speak>We can measure the height of the soda guyzer</speak>
<speak>Push the button in the middle of the screen to see how this experiment works</speak>

<speak>In this experiment, there are only four things we can change, any of these might make a difference in the reaction between the soda and mint, these are the four variables you can test in this experiment, the type of sweetener which can be sugar</speak>
<speak>The amount of caffeine in the soda which can be some</speak>
<speak>The surface texture of the mint which can be rough</speak>
<speak>And the amount of carbon dioxide in the soda which can be higher</speak>
<speak>Or lower, this might also make a difference</speak>
<speak>Select the variable you would like to test</speak>
<speak>This variable is the independent variable of your experiment</speak>
<speak>The research question you have chosen is, Does the type of sweetener in the soda affect the strength of the reaction between soda and mints??</speak>
<speak>OK!, you have chosen as your Research Question, does the type of sweetener in the soda affect the strength of the reaction between soda and mints?</speak>
<speak>The research question you have chosen is, does the amount of caffeine in the soda affect the strength of the reaction between soda and mints??</speak>
<speak>OK!, you have chosen as your Research Question, does the amount of caffeine in the soda affect the strength of the reaction between soda and mints??</speak>
<speak>The research question you have chosen is, does the surface texture of the mint in the soda affect the strength of the reaction between soda and mints?</speak>
<speak>OK!, you have chosen as your Research Question, does the surface texture of the mint in the soda affect the strength of the reaction between soda and mints?</speak>
<speak>The research question you have chosen is, does the amount of carbon dioxide in the soda affect the strength of the reaction between soda and mints?</speak>
<speak>OK!, you have chosen as your Research Question, does the amount of carbon dioxide in the soda affect the strength of the reaction between soda and mints?</speak>
